byline.original: By LISA W. FODERARO and KRISTIN HUSSEY

abstract: Robert F Kennedy Jr defends his cousin Michael Skakel in book Framed: Why Michael Skakel Spent Over a Decade in Prison for a Murder He Didn’t Commit; holds Bronx teenagers Burton Tinsley and Adolph Hasbrouck committed 1975 murder of Martha Moxley, for which Skakel was convicted in 2002, in Greenwich, Conn; Connecticut Supreme Court is currently considering whether to reinstate conviction, which was thrown out in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Forty years after the murder of 15-year-old Martha Moxley and three years after Mr. Skakel’s conviction was thrown out, his cousin claims to have definitively solved the case.

headline.main: Robert Kennedy Jr., in Book, Says Michael Skakel Is Innocent of ’75 Murder
headline.print_headline: In Book, a Kennedy Says Skakel Is Innocent in the 1975 Murder of a Teenager

snippet: Forty years after the murder of 15-year-old Martha Moxley and three years after Mr. Skakel’s conviction was thrown out, his cousin claims to have definitively solved the case....
